intro: Antirrhinum molle var. mollissimum, commonly known as the soft velvet snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to yellow and orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This variety is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and its ability to thrive in moderate climates.
